verses.verse: Canst thou draw out <WH4900> leviathan <WH3882> with an hook <WH2443>? or his tongue <WH3956> with a cord <WH2256> which thou lettest down <WH8257>?
Canst thou put <WH7760> an hook <WH100> into his nose <WH639>? or bore <WH5344> his jaw <WH3895> through with a thorn <WH2336>?
Will he make many <WH7235> supplications <WH8469> unto thee? will he speak <WH1696> soft <WH7390> words unto thee?
Will he make <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with thee? wilt thou take <WH3947> him for a servant <WH5650> for ever <WH5769>?
Wilt thou play <WH7832> with him as with a bird <WH6833>? or wilt thou bind <WH7194> him for thy maidens <WH5291>?
Shall the companions <WH2271> make a banquet <WH3739> of him? shall they part <WH2673> him among the merchants <WH3669>?
Canst thou fill <WH4390> his skin <WH5785> with barbed irons <WH7905>? or his head <WH7218> with fish <WH1709> spears <WH6767>?
Lay <WH7760> thine hand <WH3709> upon him, remember <WH2142> the battle <WH4421>, do no more <WH3254>.
Behold, the hope <WH8431> of him is in vain <WH3576>: shall not one be cast down <WH2904> even at the sight <WH4758> of him?
None is so fierce <WH393> that dare stir him up <WH5782> <WH5782>: who then is able to stand <WH3320> before <WH6440> me?
Who hath prevented <WH6923> me, that I should repay <WH7999> him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven <WH8064> is mine.
I will not conceal <WH2790> his parts <WH907>, nor his power <WH1369> <WH1697>, nor his comely <WH2433> proportion <WH6187>.
Who can discover <WH1540> the face <WH6440> of his garment <WH3830>? or who can come <WH935> to him with his double <WH3718> bridle <WH7448>?
Who can open <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of his face <WH6440>? his teeth <WH8127> are terrible <WH367> round about <WH5439>.
His scales <WH4043> <WH650> are his pride <WH1346>, shut up together <WH5462> as with a close <WH6862> seal <WH2368>.
One <WH259> is so near <WH5066> to another <WH259>, that no air <WH7307> can come <WH935> between them.
They are joined <WH1692> one <WH376> to another <WH251>, they stick together <WH3920>, that they cannot be sundered <WH6504>.
By his neesings <WH5846> a light <WH216> doth shine <WH1984>, and his eyes <WH5869> are like the eyelids <WH6079> of the morning <WH7837>.
Out of his mouth <WH6310> go <WH1980> burning lamps <WH3940>, and sparks <WH3590> of fire <WH784> leap out <WH4422>.
Out of his nostrils <WH5156> goeth <WH3318> smoke <WH6227>, as out of a seething <WH5301> pot <WH1731> or caldron <WH100>.
His breath <WH5315> kindleth <WH3857> coals <WH1513>, and a flame <WH3851> goeth out <WH3318> of his mouth <WH6310>.
In his neck <WH6677> remaineth <WH3885> strength <WH5797>, and sorrow <WH1670> is turned into joy <WH1750> before <WH6440> him.
The flakes <WH4651> of his flesh <WH1320> are joined together <WH1692>: they are firm <WH3332> in themselves; they cannot be moved <WH4131>.
His heart <WH3820> is as firm <WH3332> as a stone <WH68>; yea, as hard <WH3332> as a piece <WH6400> of the nether <WH8482> millstone.
When he raiseth up <WH7613> himself, the mighty <WH352> are afraid <WH1481>: by reason of breakings <WH7667> they purify <WH2398> themselves.
The sword <WH2719> of him that layeth <WH5381> at him cannot hold <WH6965>: the spear <WH2595>, the dart <WH4551>, nor the habergeon <WH8302>.
He esteemeth <WH2803> iron <WH1270> as straw <WH8401>, and brass <WH5154> as rotten <WH7539> wood <WH6086>.
The arrow <WH1121> <WH7198> cannot make him flee <WH1272>: slingstones <WH68> <WH7050> are turned <WH2015> with him into stubble <WH7179>.
Darts <WH8455> are counted <WH2803> as stubble <WH7179>: he laugheth <WH7832> at the shaking <WH7494> of a spear <WH3591>.
Sharp <WH2303> stones <WH2789> are under him: he spreadeth <WH7502> sharp pointed things <WH2742> upon the mire <WH2916>.
He maketh the deep <WH4688> to boil <WH7570> like a pot <WH5518>: he maketh <WH7760> the sea <WH3220> like a pot of ointment <WH4841>.
He maketh a path <WH5410> to shine <WH215> after <WH310> him; one would think <WH2803> the deep <WH8415> to be hoary <WH7872>.
Upon earth <WH6083> there is not his like <WH4915>, who is made <WH6213> without <WH1097> fear <WH2844>.
He beholdeth <WH7200> all high <WH1364> things: he is a king <WH4428> over all the children <WH1121> of pride <WH7830>.
